titlestmt.titleproper: Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania family collections (FCs) 1892-1984
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania family collections (FCs)
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: This vast artificial collection consists of records originally compiled by the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania. While most of the material is arranged by family name, some records by compiler and by location can also be found. These records comprise a variety of materials including researcher notes and correspondence, reports, newsclippings, typescripts and Photostats of original documents, reprints of family crests, photographs, and printed material. There are some original volumes and papers such as deeds and certificates of death. Within many files arranged by family is material regarding related families of different surnames. Most of the documentation is secondary research material and undated. Oversized documents consist of family trees, many of which are elaborately rendered.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
